Html:
Love the script and can't wait to use it. Ran into a problem though. We're using jquery 1.8.0 because it's a requirement of another script. If I try to run RateIt with this version it chokes.
It will display the stars, but as soon as you mouse over it it throws errors:

m.getBoundingClientRect is not a function
http://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.8.0/jquery.min.js

And of course from there a lot of "is not a function".

If I switch it back to the 1.7.2 from the example it works fine.

Any ideas?

Thanks for the feedback.

I will check the issue tomorrow, but what I vaguely recall is that there was some issue with jQuery 1.8.0 (and perhaps also 1.8.1), could you try it out on 1.8.2 or 1.8.3 and see if that fixes it?

I will anyway have a l look at it tomorrow.

Bye,
Gidon

Fantastic! jQuery 1.8.2 and 1.8.3 seem to both work and they aren't mangling any other scripts.

Thanks for the assistance and the wonderful script!

Shane
